div.p: God with us. Beloved son, the unrest in Lucerne has been settled for now, and my lords are back home. The four cantons have separated: Uri, Schwyz, Unterwalden, Zug. The old mercenaries from France, they say, are all (at least those who are left) coming home. The departure of the 6000 will soon begin; there is neither good weather nor any other fortune or blessing. May it happen to them according to God's judgment. I thank you for the 2 partridges and 2 sausages. Here I send you the thick penny for the 2 partridges. If you are happy that I pay you, then give the thick penny to Susana.
Greet her, Lysinli, and your household for me. I have not heard anything from Glarus yet. All my people greet you. God be with you.
Greet young master Hans and his household for me. To my dear son Hans Rudolf Bullinger, pastor at Berg.
